title: Federal Judge Acquits Professor Accused of Hiding China Ties
summary: Judge Thomas Varlan said the U.S. government failed to make its case in a bellwether trial over alleged research grant fraud. WASHINGTON-A federal judge in Tennessee on Thursday acquitted a professor who had been accused of hiding his China ties when applying for research grants to work on a NASA project, saying the U.S. government hadn't proven its case.

title: Los Angeles Schools Require Covid-19 Vaccine for Students
summary: In the country's second-largest district, students 12 years and up must receive the vaccine to attend class in person. Los Angeles public schools are requiring students ages 12 and older to get the Covid-19 vaccine by January to continue attending school in person, making the school system the first large district in the country to mandate the shots for children.

title: 'Moneyball' Analytics Help Fight Wildfires. This Year's Blazes Are Testing Their Limits.
summary: Resume Subscription. SOUTH LAKE TAHOE, Calif.-When the Caldor Fire roared toward a granite ridge above South Lake Tahoe last month, some computer models that firefighters were using showed the blaze stopping in its tracks. A conflicting calculation showed something unprecedented: the inferno jumping the ridge and racing toward the resort.

title: Texas Law Would Allow Users to Sue Social Media Companies Over Account Bans
summary: Governor signs bill allowing residents to sue if blocked online; similar legislation passed in Florida is in legal limbo. Texas Gov. Greg Abbott signed a bill Thursday aiming to allow residents to sue social-media companies if their content or accounts are banned from their platforms, a move that comes as similar legislation in Florida remains in legal limbo after a federal judge's ruling.

title: U.S. Sets a Summer-Heat Record This Year
summary: Average temperature of 74 degrees Fahrenheit was 0.01 degree above previous record in 1936. The U.S. had its hottest summer on record, narrowly beating out highs set during the Dust Bowl in 1936.

title: A Day of Grief and Human Glory
summary: Twenty years after 9/11, New Yorkers who lived through it still feel the shock of the falling towers.. Once when I was little, seven or so, I was sitting on the couch with my Uncle Johnny and we were watching something about Memorial Day. Johnny was about 30, a veteran of Korea, and on a day off from the Brooklyn Navy Yard. On the TV they showed a cemetery and at the end they played "Taps." Suddenly Johnny stood up from the couch, saluted and held the salute with tears in his eyes. I didn't understand what I was seeing but I knew it was important, and came to understand it had to do with loyalty and grief. And of course I remember it now because that is what I am feeling toward 9/11. I just want to stand and salute as it goes by, and it is going by.

title: Transforming America in 17 Days
summary: Democrats rush to pass their cradle-to-grave entitlement agenda with little debate or scrutiny.. Congress is back in session, and don't blink or you may miss the plan to transform America in 17 days. Never mind Sen. Joe Manchin's "strategic pause." Democratic leaders are moving to ram into law their $3.5 trillion plan for cradle-to-grave entitlements with the narrowest of majorities before Americans figure out what they're doing. As Nancy Pelosi famously said about ObamaCare, Congress will pass the bill so people can find out what's in it.

title: Merrick Garland's Texas Two-Step
summary: The AG files a lawsuit as dubious as the abortion law he wants to stop.. The Justice Department sued in federal court Thursday to block the new Texas abortion law, and its main result will be to prove that both parties are willing to abuse the law to serve their political ends on this fraught issue. It's another low moment for Attorney General Merrick Garland, as he seems dedicated again to satisfying the political demands of the White House.

title: Mr. Biden's Fish Story
summary: Thousands of jobs are put in jeopardy by a Jones Act crackdown.. Combine a willful bureaucracy with a bad law, and what do you get? Economic destruction, which is what's happening thanks to an out-of-nowhere decision from Customs and Border Protection (CBP) to enforce the Jones Act by blocking a decade-old supply chain for seafood from Alaska.

title: Big Business for Big Government
summary: AT&T wants the FCC to hobble its 5G competitor, T-Mobile.. The biggest threat to competition and consumers in our time is the collusion of big business and big government. As a case in point, see how AT&T is urging the Federal Communications Commission to hobble rival T-Mobile .

title: Remember Todd Beamer of United 93
summary: His heroism on 9/11 drew from a lifetime of faith and character.. Princeton Junction, N.J.

title: Reality Bites Reconciliation
summary: The Democratic feud over healthcare dollars is a glimpse of battles to come.. Democrats this week released the first text of their $3.5 trillion plan to remake the country. It didn't take long for the party cracks to become chasms.

title: 'Survival of the City' Review: Saving Our Urban Future
summary: Insiders have captured control of how American cities operate-and used that control to enrich themselves.. In 2011, Harvard economist Ed Glaeser published a paean to the world's biggest cities-and to one city in particular, New York. A decade earlier, the terrorist attacks on 9/11 had shocked the world-and raised questions about the vulnerabilities of the world's biggest cities. Mr. Glaeser's book, "Triumph of the City: How Our Greatest Invention Makes Us Richer, Smarter, Greener, Healthier, and Happier," announced that those cities had not just rebounded, they had conquered.

title: Jewish Tradition and National Unity
summary: The high holidays offer lessons that can be helpful to all Americans.. The ram's horn, or shofar, is sounded throughout the Jewish high holidays of Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur as a call for Jews to reflect, reform and repent. Many of us are doing exactly that this month. The lessons associated with these holidays, which both happen in September this year, are more relevant than ever to all Americans.

title: China's Climate Promises Aren't Worth the Paper They're Written On
summary: Could the Communist Party be more clear that it does not keep its word?. "China Plays the Climate Card" (Review & Outlook, Sept. 3) merits careful reading. In making environmental policy choices, the Chinese Communist Party under Xi Jinping sees climate change as an existential threat-not for the planet, but for the regime's survival.

title: The Tax Gap and the Biden Plan to Beef Up the IRS
summary: Before we raise taxes on people who pay what they owe, let's collect taxes that are legally due from the highest-income earners.. Regarding your editorial "Biden's Dream of an IRS Strike Team" (Sept. 4): Most readers would jump at the chance to earn a 2.5x to 6x return on every dollar invested. That's what the Biden administration's plan to fund the Internal Revenue Service and catch tax cheats would yield, according to two respected estimates. But the editorial board dismisses this as not worth the bother. The tax gap-taxes owed but not paid-is $600 billion annually and growing. Before we raise taxes on people who pay what they owe, let's collect taxes that are legally due from the highest-income earners.

title: Inheritance, Estates and the Step-Up in Basis Rule
summary: Should the full value of what's left to heirs be theirs to keep?. I applaud former Sen. Max Baucus, a Democrat, for taking a stand against the disastrous plan to eliminate the step-up in basis at death on capital gains ("A Tax Plan to Destroy Farms and Ranches," op-ed, Sept. 2). As a financial adviser, I was amazed that so few people, even those with substantial assets, understood what the step-up in basis meant for their heirs. It was then gratifying to see the heirs' relief when they realized that, because of the step-up in basis, they could keep the full value of their inheritance.

title: Taliban Let Americans, Other Foreigners Fly Out of Kabul
summary: Frightened families, some surfacing after weeks in hiding, board first flight out since U.S. withdrawal. KABUL-Afghanistan's Taliban authorities allowed 113 Americans, U.S. permanent residents and holders of other Western passports to leave the country on a flight to Qatar on Thursday, the first such departure by air since U.S. forces withdrew last month.

title: MacArthur, Truman and the Conduct of the Korean War
summary: The great general's plan, had it been followed, would have secured a unified Korea.. Gen. Douglas MacArthur was one of America's greatest military warriors and a brilliant battle strategist. His invasion through Inchon is ranked as one of the greatest turning movements in military history. His effort changed the course of the Korean War and drove the North Korean army to its northern borders.

title: Environmental Progress Amid Climate-Change Hype
summary: Good news isn't popular with the media and many activists.. In "Media Can't Handle the Climate Truth" (Business World, Sept. 4), Holman Jenkins identifies some good news in the U.N. Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change's projections. Unfortunately, when climate change dominates the ecological conversation, improvements in water quality, air quality and habitats are ignored, along with the decline in hazardous waste sites and oil spills.

title: Wells Fargo Fined $250 Million for Problems in Its Mortgage Business
summary: The OCC said lender has failed to fix issues first identified in 2018. Regulators fined Wells Fargo & Co. $250 million for lack of progress in addressing longstanding issues in its mortgage business.

title: Democrats Advance Plan to Require Employers to Offer Retirement Plans
summary: Companies with more than five employees that fail to comply would face fines. Democrats have included a provision in their $3.5 trillion healthcare, education and climate bill that would require companies without retirement plans to automatically enroll workers in individual retirement accounts.

title: 'If Elder Were a Democrat'
summary: Without double standards, would the U.S. media have any standards at all?. We live in an age of career cancellations over politically incorrect language and perceived "microagressions." And then there's Larry Elder, about whom one is allowed to say almost anything-and even attempt to physically assault-without much fear of media condemnation.

title: How 9/11 Changed Architecture
summary: After the Twin Towers fell, architects didn't take long to build more secure-and ever taller-buildings. The televised destruction of the World Trade Center gave the public a shock tutorial on the nature of a building: the deft structural legerdemain that holds it up, its essential place in the image of a city (which can be as essential as a nose to a face), its insolent strength and its heartbreaking fragility. One had naturally assumed that two 110-story towers were as solid and immutable as a cliff. And yet before our eyes they evaporated into a cloud of smoke and dust.

title: How 9/11 Changed Art
summary: In the aftermath of the terror attacks, some artists and photographers dealt directly with the cataclysm, but in the years that followed most failed to fully engage with the horrors of that day. New York

title: How X-Ray Vision Exposes Our Atoms
summary: A trip to the radiologist provides a reminder that we're mostly made up of six elements, and just one reflects X-rays strongly enough to form a clear picture. Physicist Helen Czerski explores the complex science behind familiar phenomena. Read more columns here.

title: Airlines Warn of Dimming Outlook Amid Delta Variant
summary: United, Southwest, American and others say surge in Covid-19 cases has hampered travel rebound. Airlines warned Thursday of another pandemic-driven hit to profits in the months ahead, as the Delta variant interrupts a rebound in air travel.

title: FDA Needs More Time to Decide Fate of Juul
summary: Regulator says it has more work to do on top-selling e-cigarette brands, which are in final review stages. The Food and Drug Administration said it needed to take more time before deciding whether e-cigarettes made by Juul Labs Inc. and other top manufacturers can remain on the U.S. market.

title: 'Scenes From a Marriage' Review: Cracks in a Facade
summary: A reboot of Ingmar Bergman's 1970s miniseries about a husband and wife gets gender switched.. Remakes abound, their intentions frequently confound, but if there was ever a property ripe for a reboot it's "Scenes From a Marriage." The 1973 original by Ingmar Bergman (a six-part Swedish TV miniseries, later edited into a feature film) was a frank, troubling-for-its-time analysis of what love, marriage and sex really meant, how they were lived, how they could all go to hell. Nearly 50 years later, the ending might often be the same, but the romantic relationship as an institution has undergone a revolution. If you want to amuse yourself during the bleaker moments of HBO's sobering new version, you might begin by making a list of the places where it departs from Bergman.

title: At Telluride, the Clouds Lift
summary: The annual film festival rose to Covid-19 challenges and returned, delightfully, with highlights that included 'Belfast,' 'King Richard' and 'Marcel the Shell With Shoes On'. Telluride, Colo.

title: Epic Games' Houseparty App to Shut Down
summary: Team behind video-chat app to work on other products for 'Fortnite' maker. Houseparty, the group video-chat app that grew popular during the Covid-19 pandemic, is shutting down in October, the company said Thursday.

title: 'LuLaRich' Review: Fashion Crime
summary: An Amazon Prime series looks at LuLaRoe, a clothing company accused of running a pyramid scheme. There's something deeply if perhaps cheaply satisfying about seeing smug hucksters brought low, which is the promise of "LuLaRich," a docuseries on Amazon Prime that explores the stratospheric ascent of the women's clothing company LuLaRoe, accused of operating as a pyramid scheme that hoodwinked homemakers and lifted their life savings. Anyone looking for a big fat payoff, however, might as well be selling LuLaRoe leggings.

title: Ray-Ban and Facebook's Camera-Equipped Sunglasses Mix Cool With Creepy
summary: Ray-Ban's Stories look like classic sunglasses. Except they're made in partnership with Facebook and have built-in cameras that are hard to spot. We tested them.. Look, did I feel creepy recording my mother and my aunt without them knowing? Or my barista? Or a random couple at the coffee shop? Or my Uber driver? Or...an aggressive squirrel in Central Park? I sure did, but I was just doing my job.

title: Why Beijing Wants BlackRock but Not Capitalism
summary: Economists know China needs financial reform, but the Party won't loosen political control.. George Soros is creating an emperor's-new-clothes moment for Wall Street by raising some provocative questions about why foreign finance companies would trip over themselves to rush into China. As BlackRock launches a $1 billion mutual fund aimed at Chinese savers, a separate question arises: What's in it for Beijing?

title: Here's What You Need to Know About Britney Spears's Conservatorship
summary: Resume Subscription. The pop star makes progress in unwinding the legal agreement that has ruled her life for 13 years

title: Big Four Firms EY, Deloitte Report Higher Revenue
summary: The professional-services firms are looking to expand their technology offerings to clients. Ernst & Young and Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu both recorded higher revenue for the past fiscal year, allowing them to plan for further investments in services and technologies for clients.

title: Stocks Turn Lower After Jobless Claims Data
summary: The S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average notched their four consecutive days of declines. U.S. stocks fell Thursday, as concerns about slowing U.S. economic growth and rising Covid-19 cases weighed on investor sentiment.

title: Russia, Belarus Agree on Economic Integration Pacts
summary: The agreements, which cover trade, labor, currencies, taxes and energy, will deepen Moscow's sway over its neighbor. MOSCOW-Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Belarusian counterpart, Alexander Lukashenko, signaled plans to deepen ties between Russia and Belarus, a major step forward in the Kremlin's long-held goal of exerting greater influence over its smaller neighbor.

title: Investors Keep Waiting for the Re-Reopening
summary: Investors are still looking ahead to a post-pandemic future, but the time frame keeps getting muddied. Someday, with hope, not very long from now the resurgence in Covid-19 cases now gripping the country will go away. How should investors be thinking about that?

title: Shell Weighs Mandating Covid-19 Vaccines for Workers
summary: Other oil producers, including Chevron, already require shots for personnel at some sites. Royal Dutch Shell PLC is considering requiring that workers in select locations, including the Gulf of Mexico, receive Covid-19 vaccines, according to a company document.

title: White House Picks D.C. Regulator for Federal Energy Regulatory Commission
summary: Biden nominates Willie L. Phillips to FERC; appointment requires Senate confirmation. The Biden administration said it would nominate Willie L. Phillips, a utility regulator for the District of Columbia, to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission.

title: Amazon to Pay for Bachelor's Degrees for U.S. Workers
summary: E-commerce giant will expand college education benefit as it battles to hire hourly workers in tight U.S. labor market. Amazon.com Inc. is offering to pay college tuition for more than 750,000 U.S. employees, as the battle for hourly workers escalates beyond minimum wages.

title: A Houston Home With a Regulation Size Ballroom Asks $13.95 Million
summary: The sellers, who danced professionally together, built the 2,400-square-foot space over the garage. A Houston home with a private ballroom and a glass sculpture custom designed by artist Dale Chihuly has listed for $13.95 million.

summary: Details include a custom-designed orchid room and two-story entry hall featuring a 15-foot glass sculpture by artist Dale Chihuly.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

summary: Other features include Venetian plaster accents, hand applied stenciling, gold leaf accents and a regulation-size ballroom.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Macklowe Art Collection to Be Sold Off for $600 Million by Sotheby's
summary: After a high-profile divorce, the real-estate mogul and his ex-wife plan biggest auction since Rockefeller. New York real-estate developer Harry Macklowe is best known for building skyscrapers, but the art collection he and ex-wife Linda Macklowe amassed over the past half-century could top $600 million when Sotheby's sells it off as part of their divorce starting this fall.

title: IT Leaders Adjust Hiring Strategies With Tech Talent Even More in Demand
summary: IT job market has added about 13,000 positions during each month of 2021 so far. Information-technology leaders say they are boosting compensation packages and flexible work options to widen the pool of prospective job candidates, as demand surges for tech talent.

title: Oil Prices Fall After China Says It Plans to Release Stockpiles
summary: A Chinese government agency said it would strategically release oil from reserves, adding to pressures on the market. Oil prices fell Thursday after China's plans to release stockpiled crude increased worries that global supply could grow even as a resurgence in the pandemic drags on demand.

title: White House Pulls ATF Pick David Chipman
summary: Nominee was opposed by Republicans and struggled to lock down support of centrist Democrats. WASHINGTON-The White House withdrew the nomination of David Chipman to lead the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, in the face of Republican opposition and tepid support from centrist Democrats, underscoring the challenges facing President Biden's stalled efforts to further regulate guns.

title: Dude, Where's My Car? (Friday Crossword, September 10)
Star of the Munich Auto Show? The Push for Faster Electrification
summary: German car makers emphasized sustainability and climate policy as they unveiled all-electric concept cars and promised to end tailpipe emissions sooner. DESPITE THE global pandemic and a crippling shortage of silicon chips, German car makers brought a crazy-positive, get-er-done attitude to this week's opening of the Munich auto show. I guess it's fun to do the right thing, especially when you have no choice.

summary: A behavioral economist answers questions on applying for jobs after a gap in employment and renovating to make the house of your dreams.

title: Bestselling Books Week Ended September 4
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: UPS, Postal Service Aim to Hire Thousands of Seasonal Workers
summary: Their plans come as businesses are finding it hard to hire new employees. United Parcel Service Inc. and the U.S. Postal Service are aiming to hire more than 140,000 workers combined for the busy holiday season as businesses across the country struggle to expand their rosters amid a tight labor market.

title: Private Palm Beach Island to Ask $120 Million-$35 Million More Than It Sold for in July
summary: The developer is giving buyers the option to buy Tarpon Island as is, or pay $200 million for an extensive renovation and addition. In the sizzling-hot, pandemic-fueled Palm Beach real-estate market, Todd Michael Glaser may have hit the jackpot: He is relisting a private island for $120 million-or $35 million more than he and his partners paid in July.

title: Biden Administration Unveils Plan to Cut Prescription-Drug Prices
summary: The Department of Health and Human Services plan supports legislation to empower the government to negotiate Medicare drug prices. A Biden administration plan to lower prescription-drug prices offers the first detailed road map of administrative actions the White House would support in addition to legislation aimed at driving down costs.

title: The Best Everyday Wines to Stock at Home-According to WSJ Readers
summary: What's your house wine? Our readers shared the affordable, easy-drinking, food-friendly wines they rely on. These five stood out.. TWO MONTHS AGO I asked readers to send me the names of their favorite everyday wines. I thought I might hear from a few dozen at most; I was wrong. I've received over 180 emails as of this writing and the correspondence goes on.

title: Want to Stand Out on Zillow? Try a Knight or a Dinosaur
summary: As real-estate agents flood a hot housing market, some are getting creative; 'The main thing is to catch people's attention'. Michael Bergstrom is used to fielding strange requests. After all, "there's not too many people running around with full suits of armor," said the Renaissance re-enactor.

title: Airlines Join White House Effort for Cleaner Jet Fuel
summary: Biden administration plans to put up $4.3 billion to lower jet-fuel emissions by 20%. The Biden administration announced a new effort to clean up jet fuel, aiming to cut its greenhouse-gas emissions by one-fifth before the end of the decade.

title: ECB Sticks With Easy-Money Policies to Counter Delta's Impact
summary: Central bank says it will conduct bond purchases as a 'moderately lower pace'. FRANKFURT-European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde signaled that the bank will keep monetary policy loose for some time amid a resurgence in Covid-19 cases globally and signs of economic slowdown in China and the U.S. that have prompted caution from the Federal Reserve.

title: JPMorgan to Buy Restaurant-Discovery Service the Infatuation
summary: Deal is the bank's latest effort to cater to big spenders who like to travel and dine out. America's biggest bank is buying the company behind the Zagat brand.

title: Can a Countertop Oven Replace Your Range? We Tested 5 to Find Out
summary: More versatile than a microwave, often quicker than a range, sleek countertop ovens promise to deliver a meal with ease. Are they worth the hype?. MUCH SMALLER than traditional ranges, countertop ovens are workhorses-or rather workponies. With "smart" functionality (and companion apps controlled via phones) and guided recipes, these devices are a little like having a highly responsive, deferential and no-attitude chef in the kitchen with you. Some actual chefs are big fans.

title: Amazon to Launch New Fire TV Sets
summary: Tech giant announces new Fire TV sets, an expansion of private-label business. Amazon.com Inc. plans to roll out Fire TV sets that will feature its Alexa voice assistant, an expansion of its private-label products that also showcases a growing ambition to place itself at the center of customer living rooms.

title: What Higher Ed Can Learn From Hospitals
summary: The pandemic has hit both industries hard, but healthcare has adapted better to market and cost pressures.. America is emerging from the Covid-19 pandemic with a changed economy. Many companies won't survive, and others will be permanently altered. America's universities are also wounded financially, and some may have to defer or eliminate classes in the fall-a potential death knell for the weakest. University presidents must learn from their healthcare counterparts and adapt before it's too late.

title: Condoleezza Rice: We Are More Secure Than We Were on 9/11
summary: Remember the victims and the heroes, but most of all remember the feeling of national unity.. 'A plane has hit the World Trade Center," my young assistant shouted. "What?" I asked. "Was it a small plane?" "No," he replied. "A commercial airliner." Within minutes there was a second plane. Then a third. America had been changed forever.

title: Walmart to End Quarterly Bonuses for Store Workers
summary: Retailer says the benefit, part of potential compensation of hundreds of thousands of workers, would be rolled into their hourly wages. Walmart Inc. is phasing out its decades-old quarterly bonuses for store workers, according to the company, as it implements hourly wage increases for hundreds of thousands of its employees.

title: How Djokovic Turned Defense Into Grand Slam Titles
summary: No one in tennis history is better prepared to grind down opponents than the fittest man in tennis. Now the world's No. 1-ranked player is just two victories from a sweep of all four majors.. It was after midnight in Queens and Novak Djokovic was on his fourth shirt of the evening.

title: Aid Agencies Ponder How to Help Afghans Without Abetting the Taliban
summary: Political upheaval, financial crunch, drought and brain drain compound looming humanitarian crisis. KABUL-Trying to forestall a humanitarian catastrophe in Afghanistan, the United Nations and aid organizations are looking for ways to help the Afghan people without bolstering the country's new Taliban administration, many of whose leaders remain under international sanctions.

title: CFTC Departure to Leave Five-Person Panel With One Republican, One Democrat
summary: Dan Berkovitz, a Democrat, plans to exit, which could heighten the urgency for Biden to fill vacancies. WASHINGTON-One of the three remaining members of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission said Thursday he plans to resign, leaving the five-person panel that regulates derivatives evenly split between one Republican and one Democrat.

title: As Travel Falters, Airlines Are Still Mustering for the Post-Covid-19 Battle
summary: Europe's easyJet has been more cautious than other low-cost airlines in trying to gain strategic advantages from Covid-19, but this may be about to change. As U.S. airlines retrench, Europe's easyJet is raising funds for expansion. Its newfound aggression may say more about competition than the status of the post-pandemic recovery.

title: 5 Ways Designers Are Making Statement Decor Fit In and Stand Out
summary: Resume Subscription. Weeks after Shetal Mehta purchased her "it" couch, she broke the news to her interior designer.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall Sharply to New Pandemic Low
summary: Initial filings for unemployment benefits fell to 310,000 last week. Filings for jobless benefits last week fell and reached a pandemic low, extending a downward trend as demand for labor remains high and employers hold onto workers despite the Delta variant of Covid-19.

title: BuzzFeed Revenue Jumps 51% Ahead of Public Listing
summary: Digital publisher plans to go public in a SPAC deal with Complex Networks slated to close later this year. BuzzFeed Inc. reported quarterly earnings Thursday for the first time since announcing plans to go public, telling investors that its advertising revenue rose sharply as the economy emerged from the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: EasyJet Rebuffs Bid From Rival as Airlines Reel From Pandemic
summary: Wizz Air's approach was the first publicly disclosed attempt at significant consolidation in the pandemic-ravaged airline industry. LONDON-One of Europe's biggest carriers rebuffed a takeover proposal by a smaller rival, in the first publicly disclosed attempt at significant consolidation in the pandemic-ravaged airline industry.

title: Microsoft Delays Full Headquarters Reopening to Undetermined Future Date
summary: Software giant stops trying to predict when U.S. offices may be widely reopened. Microsoft Corp. is abandoning plans to fully reopen its headquarters and other U.S. sites early next month and won't set a new date, for now, given uncertainty around Covid-19.

title: The 9/11 Attacks in Historical Perspective, 20 Years On
summary: Five scholars reflect on the ways in which the events of Sept. 11 have informed American and global politics. By Margaret MacMillan

title: The Power of the Latin Mass
summary: A new decree from Pope Francis discourages the use of an ancient liturgy that carries special meaning for some worshippers. In July, Pope Francisissued a decree permitting local bishops to ban the Latin Mass in their dioceses and instructing them to do so in parish churches, where the vast majority of Catholics worship. It was the latest development in a liturgical debate that has divided Catholics since the 1960s, when the Second Vatican Council ushered in a host of modernizing changes, including a new version of the Mass meant to foster more active participation by the congregation.

title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar Was Treated for Breast Cancer
summary: Former Democratic presidential candidate says she had lumpectomy and went through radiation. Sen. Amy Klobuchar said she was treated for breast cancer earlier this year.

title: Bribery Charges Unsealed Against Former Ericsson Employee
summary: The former account manager for Ericsson in East Africa is at large, according to prosecutors. The U.S. Justice Department has charged a former account manager for Swedish telecommunications company Ericsson AB with allegedly taking part in a scheme to bribe high-level officials in the Republic of Djibouti.

summary: Resume Subscription. Author

title: Robert L. James Extended McCann's Global Reach
summary: Ad agency CEO, who has died at age 84, raced sailboats and established a prize for scientists. As chief executive of the New York-based ad agency McCann-Erickson from 1985 to 1994, Robert L. James resisted the merger mania of that era. While such rivals as Saatchi & Saatchi PLC made audacious acquisitions, McCann methodically augmented the international network of offices that had been its calling card for decades.

title: A Joint 'Replacement' Without Surgery? It's on the Horizon
summary: With better drugs and stem-cell therapies, researchers hope to repair cartilage-or prevent damage-before osteoarthritis sets in or an operation is needed. Author

title: Number Puzzles (Saturday, September 11)
Fed's Bostic: Door Remains Open to Bond Buying Taper This Year
summary: Atlanta Fed chief doesn't expect a call on tapering asset buying at this month's FOMC meeting. Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic believes the Fed will be able to pull back on its asset buying campaign this year, though he doesn't expect a decision to do so will come at the U.S. central bank's meeting this month.

title: Chinese Videogame Stocks Fall After Summons From Regulators
summary: Tencent, NetEase and others were ordered to follow recent rules imposing tighter restrictions over minors' playing time. Shares of Chinese videogame giants Tencent Holdings Ltd. and NetEase Inc. dropped Thursday, after authorities summoned the companies and ordered them to follow new rules for the online-gaming industry.

title: GameStop, Lululemon, NetEase: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: GameStop is tumbling after its earnings report, and Chinese tech companies are also sliding. Stock futures are wobbling ahead of an update on the number of Americans applying for unemployment benefits. Here's what we're watching before Thursday's trading gets under way.

title: How Metallica's 'Black Album' Became the Biggest Metal Album
summary: The career-defining blockbuster brought metal to the masses in 1991, then became a rite of passage for future generations. In the 1980s, Metallica's breakneck tempos, baroque melodies and anti-commercial attitude set the standard for underground metal. Then the band bucked expectations by entering uncharted territory-the mainstream.

title: Los Angeles Gang-Intervention Worker Is Killed
summary: Craig 'Big' Batiste, subject of WSJ article, shot multiple times near his family's home. Craig "Big" Batiste, a former gang member turned neighborhood peacekeeper, was killed Wednesday morning near Los Angeles, authorities said.

title: Acquisitions Frenzy Hits High Fashion Runways
summary: Bureau Betak has sold a majority stake to agency The Independents, joining Karla Otto, K2, The Qode and Lefty.. Bureau Betak, the event and production company founded by Alexandre de Betak in Paris in 1990, has sold a majority stake to The Independents group, according to representatives from both firms. Amid a record-setting spree of mergers and acquisitions in 2021, the deal is the latest in a string of ventures for the growing public relations and marketing agency. The deal also cements a formal partnership between two familiar fashion figures: Karla Otto has been a fixture at her clients' events for 40 years, while hearing Betak's voice on the microphone requesting "Ladies and gentlemen, please take your seat" is as ritualistic as seeing Anna Wintour taking her place in the front row.

title: These Quarterbacks Changed Teams. Now They Can Change the NFL Season.
summary: An unusual number of teams are betting this NFL season on formerly prized quarterbacks whose stars dimmed-but still may have the potential to carry a franchise. The Los Angeles Rams bet their future this offseason on Matthew Stafford, who remains a mystery after 12 years in the NFL.

title: How to Create a Magical Garden Without a Landscape Pro
summary: No landscape architects or heavy machinery forged this many-featured, terraced yard-complete with footbridge and koi pond-out of uncleared land. Just a dedicated, creative family. And it's surprisingly low-maintenance, too.. IN 1962, WHEN Suki Beeh's mother bought a mid-19th-century home on Ohayo Mountain in Woodstock, N.Y., the property was in a state of genteel dilapidation. The roof leaked, a brood of raccoons was camped in the ceilings and dense forest encroached all around. Still, the young family saw the inherent magic in the place. As Ms. Beeh, now 65, recalls her childhood, it sounds cribbed from a Pippi Longstocking story. "We raised orphaned woodchucks and porcupines and rode donkeys all over the bluestone-quarry trails of the Hudson Valley," she said. They cut down trees with handsaws and a borrowed chain saw. "My sister and I spent years cutting back woods and piling up sticks and burning brush, and my mother built a barn plank by plank, all by herself," recalled Ms. Beeh. "She wanted to teach us you can achieve anything if you're willing to work hard."

title: Germany's Center-Left Is Using Angela Merkel's Strategy to Beat Her Conservatives
summary: Olaf Scholz of the Social Democratic Party has adopted the longtime chancellor's centrist approach to lead the race to determine her successor. Angela Merkel's conservatives could lose the Sept. 26 election to a resurgent center-left energized by a new approach: imitating Angela Merkel.

title: Amazon, Microsoft Help Lift Cloud Startup Databricks to Sky-High Valuation
summary: Snowflake rival again taps private markets ahead of eventual public listing. Amid an unprecedented flood of private money flowing into startups from electric trucks to rockets, one of the hottest is a relatively little-known cloud-software vendor, Databricks Inc., which illustrates how modern computing is changing.

title: Commodity Boom Pushes China's Factory Inflation to 13-Year High
summary: Factory-gate prices rose in August at the fastest pace since the 2008 financial crisis, exacerbating cost pressure for manufacturers. HONG KONG-Higher commodity costs drove China's factory-gate prices to rise in August by their fastest pace in 13 years, defying aggressive moves by Beijing to tame a rally in metals prices.

title: Blackstone Joins Francisco Partners in Backing Dynamo Software
summary: The deal values the software business at about $900 million, according to people familiar with the transaction. Blackstone Inc. plans to join fellow private-equity firm Francisco Partners as an investor in a software business that serves the alternative investment management industry, including private-equity managers.

title: Keep an Eye on Wall Street's Clean Medicine Experiment
summary: Gwyneth Paltrow, Don Cheadle and others are betting that clean-living principles are headed to your medicine cabinet. Modern wellness trends could finally be headed to a medicine cabinet near you. This experiment is worthy of Wall Street's attention.

title: Big Investors Target Battery Makers Tied to Power Grid
summary: Resume Subscription. Big investors are charging into startups touting experimental new battery technologies that would make it possible for renewable energy sources to produce most of the country's electricity.

title: BlackRock-Soros Feud Is a Microcosm of Wall Street's China Dilemma
summary: BlackRock is making a big bet on the hunger of China's individual investors for professional asset management-and on the fraught politics of the U.S.-China relationship. Talk about a Wall Street showdown. George Soros is battling it out with Larry Fink over investing in China.

title: Tiananmen Massacre Vigil Organizers Arrested by Hong Kong Authorities
summary: Police accuse group that arranged mass candlelight remembrances of not cooperating with investigation into allegations it is a foreign agent. HONG KONG-National-security police arrested four members of the group that for decades organized an annual vigil commemorating the victims of the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre, the only such mass remembrance on Chinese soil before authorities banned it in 2020 citing pandemic restrictions on gatherings.

title: Flu Is Expected to Make a Comeback This Year
summary: Authorities are counting on vaccinations to keep case counts low this winter, after Covid-19 precautions kept last season mild. The coming flu season is on track to be much worse than the last cycle, according to health experts, who fear an influx of cases could further strain hospitals already overwhelmed by the Delta surge.

title: Funds Go Green, but Sometimes in Name Only
summary: Companies are turning their struggling funds green to capture the flood of cash into sustainable investments. Fund companies are rebranding their out-of-fashion investment offerings as green, hoping to grab a portion of the cash pouring into sustainable products. In some cases, the rebranding has been in name only.

title: Push to Let Teens Drive Trucks Interstate Divides Industry
summary: Congress considers program allowing 18- to 20-year-olds drive big rigs on interstate routes, but critics say backers are missing the point. Proposed legislation to test letting people as young as 18 years old drive big rigs interstate is exposing a divide in the trucking sector, where companies are having trouble finding workers for the grueling job of hauling goods over long distances.

title: Covid-19 Policies Ignite Battle at UT Austin
summary: Public university's efforts to comply with Texas ban on mask and vaccine mandates fuel outcry from faculty and others. AUSTIN, Texas-Scientists at the University of Texas at Austin drew up a series of projections for how Covid-19 could move through the 50,000-member student body this semester.

title: 9/11 Families Return to Ground Zero With a Mission; 'Trust Me, It Will Get Better'
summary: Resume Subscription. NEW YORK-Jeanmarie Hargrave corralled a group of tourists from Atlanta who were taking photos of the miraculous Callery pear, a living tree that was found broken in the smoky ruins of Ground Zero and slowly nursed to health.

title: Pentagon Chief Says Hopes Fading for More Open Taliban Government in Afghanistan
summary: U.S. defense secretary says he sees no evidence of reforms after Taliban appoints old guard leaders to top government positions. KUWAIT CITY-The Taliban's newly named interim Afghan government, which includes former leaders ousted 20 years ago by the U.S. invasion and members of the al Qaeda-linked Haqqani network, dashed international hopes of providing more representative leadership, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said Thursday.

title: North Korea Holds Toned-Down Military Parade
summary: Without major weapons or speech from Kim Jong Un, event appears targeted at rallying domestic audience rather than sending message to U.S. or South Korea. SEOUL-North Korea held its first military parade since President Biden took office, though the event didn't feature major military hardware or a speech from leader Kim Jong Un.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Execution of Inmate Seeking Pastor's Touch Blocked
summary: Death-row inmate John Henry Ramirez argued the state violated his rights by not allowing his pastor to touch him in his final moments. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court late Wednesday blocked Texas from executing an inmate who argued the state would violate his religious rights by refusing to allow his pastor to lay hands upon him and recite prayers as authorities put him to death.

title: Biden Administration Prepares to Sue Texas Over Abortion Law
summary: Lawsuit challenging restrictions limiting procedure to first six weeks of pregnancy set to be filed in coming days. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is preparing to sue Texas over its new law banning most abortions, people familiar with the matter said, an action that would set off a federal-state clash at a time when the future of abortion rights becomes an ever-more-pressing question before the courts.

title: Vermont Troopers Resign Amid Allegations of Covid-19 Vaccine-Card Fraud
summary: FBI is investigating accusations, first brought by other troopers. Three Vermont State Police troopers have resigned following allegations they were involved in making fake Covid-19 vaccination cards, police officials said.

title: Goldman Hires Former McKinsey Chief to Help Run Asia Business
summary: Kevin Sneader will serve as Asia co-president alongside Todd Leland. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has named Kevin Sneader to help run its operations in Asia, months after he was voted out as the leader of consulting firm McKinsey & Co.

title: Theranos Founder's Trial Begins
summary: Prosecutors allege Holmes turned to fraud to keep blood-testing startup afloat. 'Failure is not a crime,' defense answers.. SAN JOSE, Calif.-After years of making promises it couldn't keep, Theranos Inc. turned to fraud to keep money coming in the door, prosecutors told jurors during opening statements of the highly anticipated criminal trial of company founder Elizabeth Holmes.
